subject: Business
title: Leading Through Ambiguity
description: A 60-second lesson on Leading Through Ambiguity.

hook.text: The pandemic hit. Nobody knew if offices would reopen in weeks or years. Leaders had to decide anyway.

buildup.text: Ambiguity means the situation is unclear, information is incomplete, and outcomes are unpredictable.

discovery.text: In ambiguity, the leader's job isn't to have all answers â€” it's to provide direction and psychological stability.

twist.text: Leaders who pretend to know everything in a crisis lose credibility.

climax.text: New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern communicated honestly during COVID, admitting uncertainty while showing a clear plan.

punchline.text: You don't need all the answers. You need a clear next step.

quiz.question: What builds trust during ambiguous situations?
options: Admitting uncertainty while showing a clear plan
Projecting total confidence even without information
Waiting until everything is clear before communicating
